name: Ghana
description: Ghana, formerly known as the Gold Coast, is a nation located along the Gulf of Guinea on the Atlantic coast of West Africa. It’s renowned for its rich history as a former British colony, its vibrant culture, and its significant role in the transatlantic slave trade. Today, Ghana is a thriving democracy with a diverse economy driven by agriculture, tourism, and natural resource extraction. The country boasts stunning landscapes, from the coastal plains to the Ashanti rainforest and the majestic Kakum National Park.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Ghana has a rapidly growing population, largely due to high birth rates and internal migration.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is approximately 36 people per square kilometer.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Accra is the bustling capital city and economic hub of Ghana.
quickFacts.detail: It's a coastal city with a mix of modern and traditional architecture.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: English is the official language and is widely spoken throughout the country.
quickFacts.detail: However, numerous indigenous languages are also spoken.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Ghanaian Cedi is the official currency.
quickFacts.detail: Exchange rates fluctuate, but generally, 1 USD is approximately 12 GHS.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.detail: Key sectors include cocoa, gold, and tourism.

climateData.title: Climate of Ghana
climateData.description: Ghana experiences a tropical climate with two main seasons: a wet season and a dry season. The country is generally hot and humid throughout the year.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Harmattan
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The Harmattan is a dry and dusty trade wind that blows from the Sahara Desert, bringing cooler temperatures and reduced rainfall.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Rainy Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: This season is characterized by heavy rainfall and high humidity. It’s the agricultural season, with increased river levels.

naturalWonders.name: Kakum National Park
naturalWonders.description: Kakum National Park is renowned for its towering canopy walkway, offering a unique perspective on the rainforest ecosystem. It’s home to a diverse array of flora and fauna, including chimpanzees, monkeys, and numerous bird species.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The 100-meter-long canopy walkway allows visitors to walk amongst the treetops, experiencing the rainforest from a breathtaking height. The park also features a series of waterfalls and hiking trails.

naturalWonders.name: Mole National Park
naturalWonders.description: Mole National Park is Ghana’s largest national park and a haven for wildlife enthusiasts. It’s home to elephants, lions, buffalo, antelopes, and a variety of bird species.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park’s vast savanna landscape offers opportunities for game drives and guided walks. It’s a crucial habitat for many endangered species.
viewingTips: Go on early morning game drives

scientificData.Biodiversity: Over 400 species of plants and 42 mammal species

naturalWonders.name: Lake Volta
naturalWonders.description: Lake Volta is the largest man-made lake in Africa, created by the Akosombo Dam. It’s a vital source of hydroelectric power and a popular recreational area.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The lake offers opportunities for boating, fishing, and water sports. It’s also home to a diverse range of aquatic life.

ecosystemData.title: Ghana's Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Ghana’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from dense rainforests to savannas and coastal wetlands. These ecosystems support a rich array of plant and animal life.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forest Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: Ghana’s forests are home to a vast array of plant and animal species, including primates, birds, and insects.

statistics.details: A significant portion of these are endemic to Ghana.
Ghana is considered a biodiversity hotspot.

notableSpecies.name: Indri
notableSpecies.significance: Largest lemur in Madagascar, found in the rainforests.

notableSpecies.name: African Grey Parrot
notableSpecies.significance: Known for its intelligence and ability to mimic human speech.

biodiversityCategories.name: Savanna Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: Ghana’s savannas are characterized by grasslands and scattered trees, supporting large herds of herbivores and predators.

notableSpecies.name: African Elephant
notableSpecies.significance: A keystone species in the savanna ecosystem.

notableSpecies.name: African Lion
notableSpecies.significance: A top predator in the savanna.

activities.title: Activities in Ghana
activities.description: Ghana offers a wide range of activities for travelers, from wildlife viewing and cultural experiences to adventure sports and relaxation.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Ghana’s diverse landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Kakum Canopy Walk
activities.description: Walk amongst the treetops of Kakum National Park.

activities.name: Mount Afadjato Hike
activities.description: Hike to the summit of Ghana’s highest mountain.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water activities on Ghana’s beautiful coastline and lakes.

activities.name: Surfing at Axim
activities.description: Catch some waves at Axim, Ghana’s surfing capital.

activities.name: Lake Volta Boat Trips
activities.description: Take a relaxing boat trip on Lake Volta.

clothing.yearRound: Comfortable walking shoes, a hat, sunglasses
